snippet: Board members said the $29 billion plan would benefit riders across the New York City region, and they thanked Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo and Mayor Bill de Blasio for increasing funding for the system.
abstract: Metropolitan Transportation Authority board praises deal made between New York State and New York City officials on $29 billion spending plan.
lead_paragraph: Board members said the $29 billion plan would benefit riders across the New York City region, and they thanked Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo and Mayor Bill de Blasio for increasing funding for the system.

headline.main: M.T.A. Approves Budget, but Deal Cuts 2nd Ave. Line Funding
